newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Zambia says to privatise Mpelembe drilling firm.
newsitem.headline: Zambia says to privatise Mpelembe drilling firm.

text.p: Zambia said on Thursday that it aims to privatise 80 percent of its state-owned Mpelembe Drilling Co Ltd.
Mpelembe is a 100-percent owned unit of Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM). The privatisation of ZCCM represents the next big step in Zambia's already advanced privatisation programme.
In adverts placed in the South African press the agency said Mpelembe had posted a turnover of $7.4 million in 1995/96 and a pre-tax profit of $730,000.
Mpelembe lies 300 kilometres north of Lusaka and is the only local contract mining firm in Zambia. The firm has 1,483 workers and 1,147 contract employees.
